title: In Israel, Iran attack is a 'nightmare inside a nightmare' for a society that knows little peace
summary: Iran's first direct attack on Israeli soil on Saturday night had a small impact on a society accustomed to conflict and still traumatized by the October 7 massacre.

title: Champions League: PSG comeback to defeat Barcelona and advance to the semi-finals
summary: Paris Saint-Germain produced a stunning comeback to beat Barcelona 4-1 away in the second leg of their Champions League quarter-final on Tuesday and seal a place in the last four with a 6-4 aggregate victory.

title: Sudan: Torn apart by a year of war
summary: Clashes between the regular Sudanese army forces and General Hemedti's troops has not stopped, forcing nearly 8 million Sudanese people to flee. The civilian population is on the brink of starvation.

title: Israel-Hamas war: The limits of Iran's 'unity of fronts' strategy
summary: By forcing Tehran to become more involved in the conflict with Hamas, Israel has set a trap for the Islamic Republic, forced to choose between supporting its allies or the risk of open war.

title: France recalls their ambassador to Azerbaijan
summary: Paris has accused Baku of 'damaging' ties between the two countries, which have long been plagued by tensions focused on the Azerbaijani region of Nagorno-Karabakh.

title: Who is Stormy Daniels, one of the key witnesses in Trump's criminal trial?
summary: She is at the heart of the criminal proceedings against Donald Trump, which began on April 15. The former porn actress claims she was paid to keep quiet about a sexual encounter she allegedly had with the former president in 2006.

title: Egypt, a dead end for Sudanese exiles
summary: The authorities in Cairo have tightened the requirements for entering and staying on Egyptian territory, forcing refugees to cross the border illegally.

title: Trump's criminal trial seats seven jurors
summary: Over two days, dozens of potential jurors have been excused after saying they could not be impartial or because they had other commitments. Eleven more are needed before opening statements can begin.

title: Israel artist refuses to open Venice Biennale show until ceasefire, hostages freed
summary: The artist and curators representing Israel at this year's Venice Biennale announced they won't open the Israeli pavilion at the festival until there is a ceasefire in Gaza and an agreement to release hostages.

title: Paris 2024: Olympic flame begins its journey from Greece to France
summary: The Olympic flame is due to arrive in Marseille on May 8, after crossing the Mediterranean. Carried by some 10,000 torchbearers, this symbol of peace and unity will end its journey in Paris.

title: Fire rages through Copenhagen's historic stock exchange, toppling spire
summary: Located next to the Danish parliament, the building currently serves as the headquarters of the Danish Chamber of Commerce. Police said they had blocked off parts of the city center as part of fire-fighting efforts.

title: Russia but not Putin invited to D-Day anniversary in France
summary: 2024 marks the 80th anniversary of the historic D-Day Landings in Normandy.

title: Dubai hit by atypical heavy rains causing widespread flooding
summary: Torrential rain flooded roads, homes and malls and briefly halted operations at Dubai's airport as storms lashed the Gulf on Tuesday, after leaving at least 18 dead in Oman.

title: Von der Leyen forced to abandon controversial appointment
summary: The European Commission president was accused of favoritism for her choice of business envoy.

title: Josep Borrell: 'A regional war is in nobody's interest, especially not the Gazans'
summary: The European Union's high representative for foreign affairs insists on the need for appeasement in the Middle East but acknowledges the EU's limitations in influencing those involved.

title: Paris 2024: French sports minister confident in 'reducing bacteriological pollution in the Seine by 75%'
summary: The minister, Amélie Oudéa-Castéra, claimed that rainwater collection facilities 'will be operational 'between April and May' and that 'disinfection units will be fully operational during the Games.'

title: BBC faces budget cuts and a digital transition crisis
summary: The British public broadcaster has lost 30% of its budget since 2010 and cut 1,800 jobs.

title: Journalism and Crisis: Join Le Monde in English for a special event in New York!
summary: Le Monde's English edition crosses the Atlantic from April 15-17 for a series of events in New York City, free and open to the public.

title: European elections: The question of Mélenchon's successor looms large
summary: The June 9 election results will be closely analyzed by the left ahead of the 2027 French presidential election, particularly within La France Insoumise (radical left), as potential successors to the three-time presidential candidate position themselves.

title: UN's Libya envoy resigns, citing no hope for political progress
summary: The UN envoy for Libya, Abdoulaye Bathily, lashed out at the country's feuding parties and their foreign backers at a UN Security Council meeting Tuesday and then confirmed he had submitted his resignation.

title: 100 days before the Paris Olympics, a look at the criticism and concern leveled at London, Rio and Tokyo
summary: While the organization of the Paris Games was disparaged even before they kicked off, the last three editions also came under fire. Despite the upheavals and significant budget increases, the events went off without a hitch.

title: Gabriel Attal's first 100 days as prime minister, amid turbulent times in France
summary: Appointed to 'regenerate' a stagnant presidential term, the prime minister has intended to focus the European election campaign on his priorities: young people and restoring authority. But polling has predicted a dismal election for his government.

title: NBA: Curry's Warriors out of playoff contention after defeat to Kings
summary: The Sacramento Kings avenged a Game 7 loss at home to the Golden State Warriors in last year's first round, with a 118-94 victory on Tuesday night.

title: Myanmar transfers democratic leader Aung San Suu Kyi to house arrest
summary: Citing the need to protect fragile detainees, including former PM Suu Kyi and ex-president Win Myint, from a heat wave, Myanmar's regime has either pardoned or reduced the sentences of over 3,300 prisoners.
